fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.tests_utils

Class AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025.tests_utils.AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeneratorGlobalTesterModel, HairDryerUnitTesterModel, HeaterUnitTesterModel

    public class AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
    The class AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel implements the basic atomic model methods for models that runs test scenarios.

    Description

    This class is a copy of AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicHIOA to pass by the simple inheritance constraint of Java.

    The class defines the methods of the DEVS protocol working hand in hand with an instant of TestScenario to execute test steps for atomic models that must perform steps in the test scenario. As an abstract class, it is mean to be extended by the concrete atomic models appearing in the simulator. Hence, atomic models must have been designed to be able to execute steps in test scenarios on order to be used that way. The atomic models doing so may either be fully dedicated to the execution of test scenarios, and then their implementation is very easy, essentially using the methods provided by this abstract class, or they can also have other internal and external transitions to be implemented, in such case, their DEVS protocol methods must be carefully defined, especially when their own transitions must mix with test steps transitions, for example when it must add to the external events to be output by the test step some other events of their own no provisioned by the test step.

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2025-10-28

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel

        public AbstractTestScenarioBasedAtomicModel(java.lang.String uri,
                                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                                            fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
        create an atomic model with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.
